task.title: Entering Receipts: Batch Receipt Entry Page
task.abstract: Users can execute a batch through the Batch Receipt Entry page.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Batch record and click the Enter Receipts button.
step.info: To return to the Batch record in Edit mode, click the Edit Batch button, represented by the cog icon.

step.cmd: Select the Entity and use the lookup to find the Customer related to the receipt. If Account is selected as the Entity, then all invoices for all contacts associated with the Account will be included in the batch.
step.info: The contact information for the Customer will display in View mode, but there is an option to edit the Contact record by clicking the Edit button. The Contact Edit page allows for changes to be made to the record.

step.cmd: Select the invoice(s) from the popup modal by selecting the related checkbox(es) and click Apply payment to selected Invoices.
step.info: Use the search icon on the Item-or-Invoice line to identify the item(s) to which the payment is being applied, if not paying for an invoice. Update the payment amount.
Price rules are not applied to receipts entered in batches.

step.cmd: Click the Apply Payment to Selected Invoices button.
step.info: Alternatively, enter the check number or credit card/bank authorization code related to the payment in the Reference Number field. Click the Save and New button to add receipts to the batch.

After saving a receipt, refresh the page to see the Expected Count and Expected Amount at the top of the Batch Receipt Entry page change to reflect the number and total amount of receipts entered. Toggle to view any batch receipts by clicking the arrow button; the receipts will display underneath the Batch Receipt Entry page.
Click the Toggle button again to hide the receipt(s) information.

taskbody.result: Once the Expected Count and Expected Amount equals the Actual Count and Actual Amount, the Batch Receipt Entry page will prompt the user to close the batch.
